mention.text: The construction workers on the site where the Oakland hills fire may have started also
the site where the Oakland hills fire may have started also
a polygraph test , an examination by that simple machine that supposedly detects the lies of those who submit to its cold wires and straps.
an examination by that simple machine that supposedly detects the lies of those who submit to its cold wires and straps.
a good prop that the examiner uses to convince people that the machine knows everything
a natural reaction to being accused , '' Leonard Saxe , a polygraph expert and psychologist
a natural reaction to being accused
a mistake to equate fear and distress with guilt.
an invasion of privacy with questionable reliability.
their anxiety and fear of being caught involuntarily cause changes in their heartbeats
a simple test to prove deception
David Lykken , professor of psychology at the University of Minnesota and a nationally known polygraph expert
the federal Employee Polygraph Protection Act
the interest of producing an accurate test
The polygraph test itself is short -- usually no more than 10 questions
veteran San Jose polygrapher George Harman

Pathological liars ; Studies also have been done by polygraphers to prove that pathological liars and psychopaths have no advantage because both types know they 're lying and neither wants to get caught

Guilty people who pass the test leave undetected. ; Those accuracy claims are challenged by polygraph opponents , who point to studies done by polygraphers themselves that say an innocent person has as much as a 50-50 chance of failing .
more accurate results for guilty people
president of the American Polygraph Association and professor of criminology at Michigan State University at East Lansing. ;
the controversy when one wants to know the accuracy of the polygraph in the real world
